name: Smith
note: One of the most common English surnames; pairs well with first names that have clear vowel endings or balanced syllables.

name: Johnson
note: Patronymic English surname; flows well with first names that avoid a heavy "n" at the end.

name: Williams
note: Welsh-origin surname common in English-speaking countries; works with a variety of first name lengths and sounds.

name: Brown
note: Short English surname; one-syllable first names can work but longer names with a soft ending often balance well.

name: Jones
note: Classic Welsh patronymic; pairs nicely with first names ending in a vowel or with two syllables.

name: Garcia
note: Spanish surname with strong Hispanic heritage; culturally pairs well with Spanish, Latin, or multicultural first names.

name: Miller
note: Occupational English surname; smooth with first names that end in a vowel or have a clear consonant-vowel transition.

name: Davis
note: Welsh-derived surname; avoids first names ending in "s" to prevent a run-on sound.

name: Rodriguez
note: Spanish patronymic; longer last name often balances with medium-length first names and Spanish or Latin first names.

name: Martinez

name: Wilson
note: English patronymic; works with first names ending in a vowel or with a different final consonant.

name: Nguyen
note: Very common Vietnamese surname; pairs well with Vietnamese names or short, clear first names in any language.

name: Anderson
note: Scandinavian patronymic; longer last name suits one- or two-syllable first names for balance.

name: Thomas

name: Taylor
note: Occupational English surname; pairs well with first names that end in a vowel or have two syllables.

name: Moore
note: Short English surname; one-syllable first names can create a strong, balanced full name.

name: Jackson
note: English patronymic; avoid first names ending in "n" to prevent a nasal run-on with "Jackson."

name: Martin
note: Latin-origin surname used in French and English; versatile with many first name styles.

name: Lee

name: Thompson
note: English patronymic; first names ending in a vowel or with two syllables often flow well.

name: Patel
note: Common Indian (Gujarati) surname; pairs well with Indian, Sanskrit, or multicultural first names.

name: Kim

name: Singh
